intro: Psychotria laevigata, commonly known as the velvetleaf Psychotria, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Psychotria laevigata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
